VB_LowerFloor_1.synopsis: This triggers has the player unlocks a door and enters a secret and, until now, hidden crypt.

PAD_SuccessfulGraverobbing.synopsis: Voicebark dialog after robbing the amulet from Jergal chapel, about whether it was right to loot the place. Its guardians might have been killed by the player. Or the guardians might have engaged the player, but they found a way to get out without killing them all, by fleeing or distracting them. Or the player might have sneakily escape the guardians.This is played on the party after they leave an area, so Speakers are roughly interchangeable here, the undertaking is assumed to be a party effort.

VB_SideChamber_1.synopsis: VB upon noticing the book chained and padlocked to the table in the side room.

VB_Sanctum_1_WithShadowheart.synopsis: Shadowheart (a cleric) remarks that she doesn't recognise the patron god of a mysterious abandoned chapel.

AD_BanditLockpickerSurprised.synopsis: Players emerge from a seemingly abandoned crypt, startling a bandit on the other side of the door. Afterward, the bandit attacks.

AD_BanditGuardWarning.synopsis: A bandit who is part of a crew looting an abandoned chapel - at this point, he's seen the players entering the chapel - 'the uninvited guests' - and thinks they're after the same loot as his crew. He's calling his friends to help.

AD_JergalInsideTomb.synopsis: Jergal reacts to a player touching his sarcophagus when his servants (the skeletal clerics) have not yet been killed.

AD_BanditGuardSpotting.synopsis: One of a group of bandits looting an abandoned chapel. He's just been surprised by the players who have infiltrated the same chapel

Jergal.synopsis: After the party has slain a group of undead scholars, the judge of death--Jergal--climbs out of his sarcophagus to greet them. He has been locked inside for years by the god Helm to atone for his part in raising the Dead Three, wicked gods who are now plotting to conquer the realms. Jergal is emotionless and excessively formal, both resigned to his fate and that of others. He is here to assist the party because that is his divine oath, not out of any true desire to act. Players can attempt to goad or attack him, but to minimal effect, as he is functionally immortal. His only goal was to see their faces, so he can find them at camp later to offer further assistance.

AD_BanditSanctumSearching.synopsis: A bandit in an abandoned chapel who is searching around an altar for a way to open a passage into the crypt, which is in the corridor outside. He's frustrated, twitchy and nervous. This place is creepy.

AD_BanditLockpickerUnlocked.synopsis: A bandit in an abandoned chapel calls to her companions for help upon spotting the player

PAD_GasPit.synopsis: Player characters comment when the player interacts with a trap that has been spotted but not yet triggered

AD_BanditCrashBanter.synopsis: A group of bandits in an abandoned chapel - they're hoping to loot the place and are a little on edge. Abandoned chapels often have traps or undead guardians. they're startled by a loud noise from one of the side-chambers. The roof just caved in, and the bandit are trying to figure out a plan of action. What they don't know is that the roof collapse was caused by the players who just broke in.

AD_BanditLockpickerCallHelp.synopsis: A bandit is surprised by the players who have found a secret entry into an abandoned chapel she was looting with her companions. She calls for help.

VB_Skeleton_1.synopsis: Player characters are commenting on skeletons in a chapel. Even though the corpses look like they are scribes, they are all armed.

AD_BanditGuardCallHelp.synopsis: One of a group of bandits looting an abandoned chapel. He's just been surprised by the players who have infiltrated the same chapel. He's twitchy and on edge, and now he's in a fight and needs his friends.

PAD_JergalStatueReaction.synopsis: Player succeeds/fails passive check to recognise statue of Jergal.

PAD_ButtonBlocked.synopsis: The player has pressed a button only to find it won't move - because it deactivates a trap they haven't triggered yet.

AD_BanditLockpickerFoundDeadBandit.synopsis: A bandit in an abandoned chapel finds one of her companions dead

VB_Sanctum_1_WithMystic.synopsis: Cleric comments on the presence of a god being felt in a long-abandoned chapel crypt, but they can't pinpoint which one.

AD_BanditLockpickerSpotting.synopsis: A bandit who was trying to pick a lock in an abandoned chapel - at this point, she's seen the players intruding on her position and tries to alert her friends as she enters combat

VB_TakingTheArtefact_1_WithShadowheart.synopsis: The player just stole a relic of Selune and all candles around it extinct. Shadowheart reacts defiantly.

AD_BanditLockpickerOpenDoor.synopsis: Mari realises that the door she was trying to unlock is suddenly opened, but she has not unlocked it.

VB_Sanctum_2_WithMysticShadowheart.synopsis: A mystic comments that they feel the power that once resided in an abandoned chapel. Shadowheart responds. Neither of them recognise which god this place is dedicated to.

AD_BanditGuardSurprised.synopsis: A bandit guarding the door to an abandoned chapel that his crew are looting. The player just surprised him and he calls for help as he enters combat

JergalWandering.synopsis: death--Jergal--climbs out of his sarcophagus to greet them. He has been locked inside for years by the god Helm to atone for his part in raising the Dead Three, wicked gods who are now plotting to conquer the realms. Jergal is emotionless and excessively formal, both resigned to his fate and that of others. He is here to assist the party because that is his divine oath, not out of any true desire to act. Players can attempt to goad or attack him, but to minimal effect, as he is functionally immortal. His only goal was to see their faces, so he can find them at camp later to offer further assistance.

VB_Artefact_1.synopsis: Players notice the tomb containing the Selune artefact.

VB_Sanctum_1.synopsis: players reflect on an the abandoned inner sanctum of a long-abandoned chapel

AD_BanditLockpickerWander.synopsis: Mari has found the door she is trying to lockpick open. She went to tell Barton, but found him dead. Now, she is looking in the room to find his killer.

VB_TakingTheArtefact_2_WithShadowheart.synopsis: The player just stole a relic from a crypt in an abandoned chapel, and all candles around it sputtered out. Sounds of movement come from another room... Shadowheart is with the party

AD_BanditSanctumSpotting.synopsis: The bandit in the chapel's inner sanctum spots the player and starts combat.

AD_UpDownDoorInvestigation.synopsis: player finds a door that has no lock or handle

PAD_FoundCoins.synopsis: Player finds a soul coin inside Jergal's chapel.

VB_TakingTheArtefact_1.synopsis: The player just stole a relic from a crypt in an abandoned chapel, and all candles around it sputtered out. Sounds of movement come from another room...

AD_BanditLockpickerLockpicking.synopsis: A bandit in an abandoned chapel - she's trying and failing to open a door to the lower level of the chapel, searching for loot. Talking to herself as she struggles - confused by the fact the door doesn't have a lock.

VB_Skeleton_2.synopsis: Player characters are commenting on skeletons in a chapel. Even though the corpses look like they are scribes, they are all armed.

AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter.synopsis: Mari has found the door to lower level open but she did not unlock it. She talks to her comrade, Barton about it.They debate what must have happened.

AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert_OnlyBarton.synopsis: Crypt bandit is on alert - likely after some masonry collapses nearby.(Same as CHA_Crypt_AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert but with only Barton as a speaker.)

AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert.synopsis: Three bandits - Barton, Mari and Haseid - are on alert in a crypt they're attempting to rob. They heard a commotion (falling masonry) and are braced for threats.
AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert.how_to_trigger: A quick way to trigger this dialog would be destroying the pillar at 284; 24; 342 (S_CHA_OUTSIDE_Fissure_Boulder) and opening the hole at the chapel, then walk throught the main locked door and kill Andorn before he calls for help. Once they are in their positions AD will trigger.

VB_Sanctum_2_WithShadowheart.synopsis: Players have entered an abandoned chapel dedicated to an unknown god. Shadowheart is puzzled as to why she can't figure out who was the patron of this place.

AD_BanditSanctumAlert.synopsis: Barton is alerted and tells the other bandits inside the room to get ready in their positions.

AD_JergalWandering.synopsis: Jergal wanders around after his conversation with the player, waiting for them to leave so he can teleport to camp and speak to them again later.

VB_LowerFloor_1_0.speaker: Player
VB_LowerFloor_1_0.text: This place wasn't built for the living.
VB_LowerFloor_1_0.context: NodeContext: Karlach: She's enjoying exploring here.

PAD_SuccessfulGraverobbing_0.speaker: Player
PAD_SuccessfulGraverobbing_0.text: They didn't want to surrender their valuables, even after death.

PAD_SuccessfulGraverobbing_3.speaker: Player
PAD_SuccessfulGraverobbing_3.text: Relics are wasted on bones. We can make much better use of them.

PAD_SuccessfulGraverobbing_2.speaker: Player
PAD_SuccessfulGraverobbing_2.text: I pity anyone caught by those things. We were lucky to get out with the loot.

PAD_SuccessfulGraverobbing_5.speaker: Player
PAD_SuccessfulGraverobbing_5.text: Relics are wasted on bones. We can make much better use of them.

PAD_SuccessfulGraverobbing_4.speaker: Player
PAD_SuccessfulGraverobbing_4.text: A lucky escape. Judging by how they fought, those things weren't happy with our looting.

VB_SideChamber_1_0.speaker: Player
VB_SideChamber_1_0.text: Looks like someone wanted to bury their secrets.

VB_Sanctum_1_WithShadowheart_0.speaker: Shadowheart
VB_Sanctum_1_WithShadowheart_0.text: I don't recognise this. Who was worshipped here?

AD_BanditLockpickerSurprised_0.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerSurprised_0.text: Hells! Something's coming out of the crypt!
AD_BanditLockpickerSurprised_0.context: NodeContext: Terrified - we just emerged from a seemingly abandoned crypt she was trying to break into

AD_BanditGuardWarning_0.speaker: Andorn
AD_BanditGuardWarning_0.context: NodeContext: He's in an abandoned chapel, looting, and has just spotted the players. He calls to his friends for help and enters combat

AD_JergalInsideTomb_0.speaker: Richly Adorned Sarcophagus
AD_JergalInsideTomb_0.text: Dost thou think to rush fate? See to the dead first.

AD_BanditGuardSpotting_0.speaker: Andorn
AD_BanditGuardSpotting_0.context: NodeContext: A bandit searching an abandoned chapel - he's just been surprised by the player. He thought he was alone here with his crew and is startled and calls for help as combat begins

Jergal_59.speaker: Withers
Jergal_59.text: Neither thy outburst nor thy apology is relevant.

Jergal_14.speaker: Withers
Jergal_14.text: See what thou hast seen. Know what thou knowest.

Jergal_22.speaker: Player
Jergal_22.text: Can you not be harmed? What magic is this?

Jergal_3.speaker: Withers
Jergal_3.text: Fate has not declared mine injury. Therefore, it shall not occur.

Jergal_8.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jergal climbing out of his tomb and standing up before the player

Jergal_56.speaker: Withers
Jergal_56.text: So he has spoken, and so thou standest before me. Right as always.

Jergal_69.speaker: Withers
Jergal_69.text: What a curious way to awaken.

Jergal_9.speaker: Withers
Jergal_9.text: Now I have a question for thee: what is the worth of a single mortal's life?

Jergal_67.speaker: Withers
Jergal_67.text: Ah, but thou lack a voice to speak. No matter. I have seen enough.

Jergal_62.speaker: Withers
Jergal_62.text: We will see each other again at the proper time and place. Farewell.

Jergal_13.speaker: Player
Jergal_13.text: Quite the question. What's the reason for it?

Jergal_1.speaker: Player
Jergal_1.text: 'So he has spoken'? What 'he' are you talking about?

Jergal_33.speaker: Withers
Jergal_33.text: An arbiter of certain matters. But that is not important now.

Jergal_15.speaker: Player
Jergal_15.text: Little spooked by the crawling out of the tomb bit. What are you?

Jergal_36.speaker: Withers
Jergal_36.text: I am not the same as those thou hast slain, if that is what thou askest.

Jergal_35.speaker: Player
Jergal_35.text: A peaceful undead. Interesting. Why aren't you attacking me?

Jergal_57.speaker: Withers
Jergal_57.text: So I ask again: what is the worth of a single mortal life?

Jergal_43.speaker: Player
Jergal_43.text: Mortals live to die. To be slaughtered.

Jergal_5.speaker: Withers
Jergal_5.text: We have met and I know thy face.

Jergal_70.speaker: Withers
Jergal_70.text: We will see each other again at the proper time and place. Farewell.

Jergal_75.speaker: Player
Jergal_75.text: Mine seems worth little, as my blood calls me to harm others.

Jergal_77.speaker: Player
Jergal_77.text: No one life is worth more than any other. We are all equal.

Jergal_18.speaker: Player
Jergal_18.text: That depends on a person's deeds.

Jergal_24.speaker: Withers
Jergal_24.text: I am sure thou believest as such.

Jergal_49.speaker: Player
Jergal_49.text: Life's only value is as currency. Doesn't matter to me otherwise.

Jergal_78.speaker: Withers
Jergal_78.text: To some, it is the only currency.

Jergal_27.speaker: Player
Jergal_27.text: Each life is of infinite value and merits sacrificing everything for.

Jergal_31.speaker: Withers
Jergal_31.text: And thus balance is achieved. If all are at war, none can win.

Jergal_71.speaker: Player
Jergal_71.text: The only life that matters is mine.

Jergal_34.speaker: Withers
Jergal_34.text: At this particular junction, perhaps that is not so far from the truth.

Jergal_44.speaker: Withers
Jergal_44.text: I am curious by what standards thou shalt judge.

Jergal_42.speaker: Player
Jergal_42.text: A life is only valuable in service to Vlaakith.

Jergal_51.speaker: Player
Jergal_51.text: Life only has value where Lolth decrees it.

Jergal_25.speaker: Player
Jergal_25.text: Some mortals live much longer than others. I can't compare them.

Jergal_68.speaker: Withers
Jergal_68.text: It is mortality just the same.

Jergal_20.speaker: Player
Jergal_20.text: In my experience, that depends on what the mortal looks like.

Jergal_74.speaker: Withers
Jergal_74.text: A life and how it is lived are different equations.

Jergal_50.speaker: Player
Jergal_50.text: A life is worth only as much as the legends remember it.

Jergal_54.speaker: Player
Jergal_54.text: Mortal lives are not 'single'. They are part of a greater whole - a path to enlightenment.

Jergal_72.speaker: Withers
Jergal_72.text: Few strive for such balance. Fewer still achieve it.

Jergal_21.speaker: Player
Jergal_21.text: That depends on the virtue of the life that is lived.

Jergal_73.speaker: Withers
Jergal_73.text: That is true, but matters not.

Jergal_65.speaker: Withers
Jergal_65.text: Dull your weapons as you wish.

Jergal_40.speaker: Player
Jergal_40.text: What manner of undead are you to ask such a question?

Jergal_7.speaker: Player
Jergal_7.text: You feel familiar. Do I know you?

Jergal_66.speaker: Withers
Jergal_66.text: Yes, but I imagine it is not the way thee believe.

Jergal_41.speaker: Withers
Jergal_41.text: Thou walk with death, child of Myrkul. That is enough for an understanding between us.

Jergal_29.speaker: Player
Jergal_29.text: You feel familiar. Do I know you?

AD_BanditSanctumSearching_0.speaker: Barton
AD_BanditSanctumSearching_0.text: Rotten food, dusty altars... where's the bloody treasure?
AD_BanditSanctumSearching_0.context: NodeContext: Referring to his surroundings in an abandoned chapel. He's searching for a way to open the crypt, or some treasure. Muttering to himself

AD_BanditSanctumSearching_1.speaker: Barton
AD_BanditSanctumSearching_1.text: At least there's no skeletons this time.
AD_BanditSanctumSearching_1.context: NodeContext: Referring to his surroundings in an abandoned chapel. He's searching for a way to open the crypt, or some treasure. Muttering to himself... the last time he tried something like this, skeletons attacked him.

AD_BanditSanctumSearching_2.speaker: Barton
AD_BanditSanctumSearching_2.text: I ain't going home empty-handed again...
AD_BanditSanctumSearching_2.context: NodeContext: grumbling to himself - he's looting an abandoned chapel and is annoyed not to have found any good loot

AD_BanditLockpickerUnlocked_0.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerUnlocked_0.context: NodeContext: spotted the player - shouting to alert her companions as she becomes hostile

PAD_GasPit_0.speaker: Player
PAD_GasPit_0.text: I can't see any way to disarm it.

AD_BanditCrashBanter_1.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditCrashBanter_1.text: Gods, there's something moving in there!
AD_BanditCrashBanter_1.context: NodeContext: a roof in the dungeon they're exploring just collapsed - they're getting into position to investigate/ambush anyone involved and are scared

AD_BanditCrashBanter_4.speaker: Andorn
AD_BanditCrashBanter_4.text: Be ready for anything. I told you this wouldn't be easy...
AD_BanditCrashBanter_4.context: NodeContext: these characters are robbing an abandoned chapel and the roof in one of the rooms just collapsed. They don't know what's happening and are VERY twitchy. The roof in one of the rooms just collapsed, and they're reacting to the sound. This guy is the pragmatic one of the bandit group - robbing crypts is dangerous work, and he knows it. Doesn't necessarily like it though

AD_BanditCrashBanter_3.speaker: Barton
AD_BanditCrashBanter_3.context: NodeContext: Panicking - these characters are robbing an abandoned chapel and the roof in one of the rooms just collapsed. They don't know what's happening and are VERY twitchy. The roof in an adjacent room just collapsed, startling them

AD_BanditCrashBanter_6.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditCrashBanter_6.text: The roof caved in - this place is a deathtrap!
AD_BanditCrashBanter_6.context: NodeContext: Panicking - these characters are robbing an abandoned chapel and the roof in one of the rooms just collapsed. They don't know what's happening and are VERY twitchy. The roof in one of the rooms just collapsed, and they're reacting to the sound

AD_BanditCrashBanter_0.speaker: Andorn
AD_BanditCrashBanter_0.context: NodeContext: these characters are robbing an abandoned chapel and the roof in one of the rooms just collapsed. They don't know what's happening and are VERY twitchy. The roof in one of the rooms just collapsed, and they're reacting to the sound, this guy is trying to take control of the situation and calm his companions

AD_BanditCrashBanter_5.speaker: Barton
AD_BanditCrashBanter_5.context: NodeContext: in an abandoned chapel, hearing noises that sound like living things in the room next door. ready to rush into danger, but not confident - speaking in hushed tones

AD_BanditCrashBanter_2.speaker: Andorn
AD_BanditCrashBanter_2.text: Nah, let 'em come to us. Then stick 'em in the guts.
AD_BanditCrashBanter_2.context: NodeContext: hushed tones - trying to set up an ambush in an abandoned chapel, not sure WHAT they're ambushing. twitchy and undisciplined

AD_BanditLockpickerCallHelp_0.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerCallHelp_0.context: NodeContext: surprised by players - calls for help from her companions and prepares for battle

VB_Skeleton_1_0.speaker: Player
VB_Skeleton_1_0.text: Armed scribes - but no sign of a struggle.

AD_BanditGuardCallHelp_0.speaker: Andorn
AD_BanditGuardCallHelp_0.context: NodeContext: alarmed - he's a tomb-robber in an abandoned chapel, and the players just surprised him. He's calling his friends to help as combat begins

PAD_JergalStatueReaction_0.speaker: Player
PAD_JergalStatueReaction_0.text: That statue. It seems they worshipped some kind of... scholar?

PAD_JergalStatueReaction_1.speaker: Player
PAD_JergalStatueReaction_1.text: That's Jergal, Scribe of the Dead. I didn't think anyone still worshipped him.

AD_BanditLockpickerFoundDeadBandit_0.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerFoundDeadBandit_0.text: Barton? Oh gods, somebody killed Barton!
AD_BanditLockpickerFoundDeadBandit_0.context: NodeContext: just found a dead friend - Barton - and is furious as she starts to hunt for the killer

VB_Sanctum_1_WithMystic_0.speaker: Player
VB_Sanctum_1_WithMystic_0.text: Something divine lingers here - but I don't recognise this presence.
VB_Sanctum_1_WithMystic_0.context: NodeContext: Player is stepping into an abandoned chapel and feels a holy presence, but can't identify the god.

AD_BanditLockpickerSpotting_0.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerSpotting_0.text: How'd you get past Andorn? Back off!
AD_BanditLockpickerSpotting_0.context: NodeContext: She was trying to pick a lock in an abandoned chapel and is surprised to see the players who have either killed or sneaked past her friend 'Andorn'. She's entering combat.

VB_TakingTheArtefact_1_WithShadowheart_0.speaker: Shadowheart
VB_TakingTheArtefact_1_WithShadowheart_0.text: Trying to frighten me with cheap tricks? Darkness is my element.

AD_BanditLockpickerOpenDoor_0.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerOpenDoor_0.text: It's... open? Could've sworn I hadn't cracked it.

VB_Sanctum_2_WithMysticShadowheart_1.speaker: Player
VB_Sanctum_2_WithMysticShadowheart_1.text: I feel a presence here - a power. The patron god of this place?
VB_Sanctum_2_WithMysticShadowheart_1.context: NodeContext: Player is stepping into an abandoned chapel and still feels the holy presence of the goddess Selune (seh-LOON-eh). She is a tranquil, protective deity.

VB_Sanctum_2_WithMysticShadowheart_0.speaker: Shadowheart
VB_Sanctum_2_WithMysticShadowheart_0.text: Whoever that even is. No intact symbols here, no dedications - nothing.
VB_Sanctum_2_WithMysticShadowheart_0.context: NodeContext: Mocking her companion's pious reference to the moon goddess, of whom she is no fan.

AD_BanditGuardSurprised_0.speaker: Andorn
AD_BanditGuardSurprised_0.context: NodeContext: he's part of a crew looting an abandoned chapel - the player just entered, surprising him. He calls for help as he backs away, in combat

AD_BanditGuardSurprised_1.speaker: Andorn
AD_BanditGuardSurprised_1.context: NodeContext: he's part of a crew looting an abandoned chapel - the player lied to him, convincing him they were part of his team, and now he's seen them and realises he's been tricked. Calls for help as he backs away, in combat

JergalWandering_2.speaker: Withers
JergalWandering_2.text: We have nothing more to discuss. Continue on thy way, as if I were not here.

JergalWandering_13.speaker: Withers
JergalWandering_13.text: I must attend this place, after so many years away. We will see each other again soon.

JergalWandering_10.speaker: Withers
JergalWandering_10.text: When the time is proper. I do not know that hour any more than dost thou.

JergalWandering_7.speaker: Withers
JergalWandering_7.text: But I do know that the longer thou standest here, the farther away our second meeting becomes.

JergalWandering_1.speaker: Player
JergalWandering_1.text: You better not follow me. There would be consequences.

JergalWandering_3.speaker: Withers
JergalWandering_3.text: I had no intention of following thee. We will find one another regardless.

JergalWandering_9.speaker: Withers
JergalWandering_9.text: Inevitability is a wheel that turns of its own accord.

JergalWandering_8.speaker: Player
JergalWandering_8.text: You seem very certain of that. How?

JergalWandering_0.speaker: Withers
JergalWandering_0.text: The mechanics of fate would be difficult to explain to one such as thyself.

JergalWandering_11.speaker: Player
JergalWandering_11.text: Seems you've read ahead in our little story.

JergalWandering_12.speaker: Withers
JergalWandering_12.text: Ah, thou as well? It is noted.

VB_Artefact_1_0.speaker: Player
VB_Artefact_1_0.text: A lot of effort to hide one sarcophagus.
VB_Artefact_1_0.context: NodeContext: Said with reverence and a touch of fear.

VB_Sanctum_1_0.speaker: Player
VB_Sanctum_1_0.text: No more prayers... only silence and dust.
VB_Sanctum_1_0.context: NodeContext: player reflects on an the abandoned inner sanctum of a long-abandoned chapel. Possibly quietly reverential; it's a holy place

AD_BanditLockpickerWander_0.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerWander_0.context: NodeContext: Searching. Calling out angrily to whoever killed her comrade.

AD_BanditLockpickerWander_1.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerWander_1.text: Come on, coward! Let's get this over with!
AD_BanditLockpickerWander_1.context: NodeContext: Searching. Calling out angrily to whoever killed her comrade.

AD_BanditLockpickerWander_2.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerWander_2.text: You killed my friend. Answer to me. Now!
AD_BanditLockpickerWander_2.context: NodeContext: Searching. Calling out angrily to whoever killed her comrade.

VB_TakingTheArtefact_2_WithShadowheart_0.speaker: Player
VB_TakingTheArtefact_2_WithShadowheart_0.text: Hells... something just woke up down here.

VB_TakingTheArtefact_2_WithShadowheart_1.speaker: Shadowheart
VB_TakingTheArtefact_2_WithShadowheart_1.text: Let them come. The darkness can be to our advantage.

AD_BanditSanctumSpotting_0.speaker: Barton
AD_BanditSanctumSpotting_0.text: Clear off - we got here first!
AD_BanditSanctumSpotting_0.context: NodeContext: seeing a threat, preparing to attack

AD_UpDownDoorInvestigation_0.speaker: Player
AD_UpDownDoorInvestigation_0.text: No lock, no handle. How does it open?
AD_UpDownDoorInvestigation_0.context: NodeContext: found a door without a lock or handle

PAD_FoundCoins_0.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundCoins_0.text: A strange coin. I wonder what it's worth.

VB_TakingTheArtefact_1_0.speaker: Player
VB_TakingTheArtefact_1_0.text: Oh, hells. Something just woke up...
VB_TakingTheArtefact_1_0.context: NodeContext: just picked up an artefact and heard something awakening in response down in a dungeon - afraid, but with resolve

AD_BanditLockpickerLockpicking_0.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerLockpicking_0.text: Not even sure this is a door.
AD_BanditLockpickerLockpicking_0.context: NodeContext: Confused - trying to unlock a door in an abandoned chapel that doesn't actually have a lock. She's struggling and muttering to herself

AD_BanditLockpickerLockpicking_1.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerLockpicking_1.context: NodeContext: Dreaming of a beer at the end of a long work day - she's trying to open a door to a crypt in an abandoned chapel and there's no handle or lock. She's struggling and muttering to herself

AD_BanditLockpickerLockpicking_2.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerLockpicking_2.context: NodeContext: Confused - trying to unlock a door in an abandoned chapel that doesn't actually have a lock. She's struggling and muttering to herself

VB_Skeleton_2_0.speaker: Player
VB_Skeleton_2_0.text: Armed scribes - but no sign of a struggle.

VB_Skeleton_2_1.speaker: Player
VB_Skeleton_2_1.text: I wonder what was so subversive about their words that they commanded protection.
VB_Skeleton_2_1.context: NodeContext: player reacts to companion commenting that skeletons in an abandoned chapel appear to have died without a fight. Slightly unnerved

AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter_0.speaker: Barton
AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter_0.text: No... you must've done something without realising. Stroke of luck.
AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter_0.context: NodeContext: Brushing off. Half-hearted attempt at reasoning.

AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter_2.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter_2.text: I know when I've got a lock beaten and I didn't beat this one.

AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter_4.speaker: Barton
AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter_4.text: Maybe it just broke by itself. This place is ancient.
AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter_4.context: NodeContext: Further weak effort at explaining the unexplainable.

AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter_3.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter_3.text: Maybe. But keep on your guard.
AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter_3.context: NodeContext: Cautious. Something doesn't add up.

AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter_5.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter_5.context: NodeContext: Surprised and a little confused.

AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter_6.speaker: Barton
AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter_6.text: Finally! I was starting to think we'd have to chop it down...
AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter_6.context: NodeContext: Oblivious to his partner's confusion. Just happy a door's been unlocked.

AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter_1.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter_1.text: No, listen! I didn't open it. Did you touch something? A lever?

AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert_OnlyBarton.speaker: Barton
AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert_OnlyBarton.context: NodeContext: Calling out to possible intruder

AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert_OnlyBarton.speaker: Barton
AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert_OnlyBarton.text: Hells. Where's Gimblebock and the others?
AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert_OnlyBarton.context: NodeContext: Terse, on alert. Wondering to self, out loud

AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert_OnlyBarton.speaker: Barton
AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert_OnlyBarton.context: NodeContext: Terse, on alert. Spoken to self, out loud

AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert_OnlyBarton.speaker: Barton
AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert_OnlyBarton.text: Got to keep my eyes peeled.
AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert_OnlyBarton.context: NodeContext: Terse, on alert. Spoken to self, out loud

AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert_10.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert_10.text: This place is falling apart - could've happened by itself.

AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert_7.speaker: Haseid
AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert_7.text: No such thing as coincidences when there's loot to be had.

AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert_8.speaker: Barton
AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert_8.text: What're Gimblebock and the others doing up there?
AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert_8.context: NodeContext: Wondering out loud - something's amiss.

AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert_0.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert_0.text: Maybe we should go take a look.

AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert_4.speaker: Haseid
AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert_4.text: Not a chance - could be a trap. Just keep your eyes peeled.

AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert_3.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert_3.text: Well it is a crypt, ain't it? Rot's to be expected.
AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert_3.context: NodeContext: Cracking a bad joke during a tense moment

AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert_5.speaker: Haseid
AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert_5.text: Shut it. This is no time for joking around.

VB_Sanctum_2_WithShadowheart_0.speaker: Player
VB_Sanctum_2_WithShadowheart_0.text: No more prayers... only dust and silence.

VB_Sanctum_2_WithShadowheart_1.speaker: Shadowheart
VB_Sanctum_2_WithShadowheart_1.text: Who were those prayers for? Normally the patron god is obvious - not here.

AD_JergalWandering_0.speaker: Withers
AD_JergalWandering_0.text: What a mess the ages cause.

AD_JergalWandering_2.speaker: Withers
AD_JergalWandering_2.text: Parchment and bone dust. Still comforting after all this time.
